description: Some federal workers say this government shutdown feels different than ones they’ve experienced in the past, partly because of the changes to federal agencies that have been going on since President Donald Trump took office in January.
title: Federal workers say this shutdown feels different

description: Ruby Chen, the father of Israeli-American soldier Itay Chen, who was among the 1,200 killed in the Hamas-led attacks on Oct. 7, 2023, tells NBC News’ Tom Llamas that he’s thankful for American officials’ efforts to bring the remains of his son home.
title: Father of soldier killed in Oct. 7 attacks thanks U.S.

author: Gary Grumbach
description: A woman who pled guilty to attempting to assassinate Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh three years ago was sentenced Friday to more than eight years in prison.
title: Woman sentenced to 8 years in prison for attempting to assassinate Brett Kavanaugh

description: A judge sentenced Sean “Diddy” Combs to 50 months in prison, fined him $500,000 and ordered five years of supervised release. NBC News' Chloe Melas reports from outside the courtroom about what the day was like in court.
title: Diddy sentenced to 50 months after emotional court day

description: Costco to sell Ozempic and Wegovy at a large discount
title: Costco to sell Ozempic and Wegovy at a large discount

description: A judge has sentenced Sean "Diddy" Combs to more than 4 years in prison. NBC News' Chloe Melas weighs in on whether he and his team could appeal the decision.
title: Will Sean 'Diddy' Combs appeal his sentence?

description: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced to 50 months in prison on Friday in New York on two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution, NBC News' Laura Jarrett reports.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to 50 months behind bars

description: NBC News’ Chloe Melas recaps what Sean “#Diddy” Combs said in court before being sentenced to 50 months in prison.
title: What Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs said in court

description: Hamas says it agreed to release all Israeli hostages, alive or dead, and expressed willingness to negotiate through mediators on President Trump’s plan for peace in the Middle East. NBC News’ Richard Engel breaks down what is and isn’t included in the plan.
title: What Hamas did — and didn’t — agree to

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court on Friday paved the way for the Trump administration to revoke temporary legal status for up to 600,000 Venezuelan immigrants, meaning some could ultimately be deported.
title: Supreme Court allows Trump to revoke protected status for thousands of Venezuelans

description: These are some of the terms in President Donald Trump’s Gaza peace deal, if the plan is accepted by all parties as is.
title: Terms of Trump’s Gaza peace deal

description: These are some of the terms in President Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan, if it is accepted by all parties as is.
title: Terms of Trump’s Gaza peace plan

description: Hamas agrees to release all Israeli hostages and negotiate through mediators, in response to President Trump’s peace proposal.
title: Hamas says it agrees to release all Israeli hostages

description: Twiggy the water-skiing squirrel wows fairgoers
title: Twiggy the water-skiing squirrel wows fairgoers

author: Adam Reiss
description: Sean “Diddy” Combs, the hip-hop mogul convicted on interstate prostitution charges, begged a federal judge for mercy during a dramatic sentencing hearing Friday, insisting he has “changed for the better.”“I can’t change the past, but I can change the future,” Combs told Judge Arun Subramanian inside the U.S.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs begs judge for mercy, apologizes for 'sick' actions ahead of sentencing

description: Ruby Chen, father of American hostage Itay Chen, tells NBC News' Tom Llamas that the "full court press" of President Trump and Steve Witkoff, special envoy to the Middle East, contributed to the success of the agreement accepted by Hamas.
title: Father of American hostage credits Trump and Witkoff for Hamas agreement

description: VP JD Vance has asked why undocumented immigrants “get health care benefits at hospitals paid for by American citizens?” The answer involves the Emergency Medical Treatment & Labor Act, which allows hospitals to immediately stabilize patients, including American citizens, without waiting to check their immigration status.
title: Policy the White House criticizes saves American lives

description: Bodycam shows police confront Michigan church attacker
title: Bodycam shows police confront Michigan church attacker

description: When asked about a timeline for potential layoffs tied to the government shutdown, Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt says there is currently work happening to identify "where layoffs have to be made and where cuts have to happen."
title: Karoline Leavitt talks about potential layoffs

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: “Fast and Furious” franchise actor Tyrese Gibson turned himself in to police Friday after his dogs allegedly killed another dog in his Atlanta neighborhood
title: Tyrese Gibson booked on animal cruelty charge in dog case

description: As part of a response to a question about the NFL's decision to have Bad Bunny perform at Super Bowl LX, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said, "There's no tangible plan" for ICE to be at the Super Bowl.
title: "There's no tangible plan" to have ICE at Super Bowl

description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt was asked about President Trump's comments about potential federal layoffs during the government shutdown. She said Democrats have "given the administration this opportunity" for the firings by not supporting federal funding legislation.
title: White House on layoffs: Democrats have 'given the administration this opportunity'

description: An emergency department doctor describes what it was like to treat people he knows following a shooting and fire at a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan. NBC News’ Adrienne Broaddus reports.
title: Doctor describes working in ER after LDS church shooting

author: Kaan Ozcan
description: Novo Nordisk, the company that makes Ozempic and Wegovy, announced Friday it will be selling the prescription injectable pens at Costco pharmacies.
title: Costco to sell Ozempic and Wegovy at a large discount for people without insurance

description: Will Sean Combs speak at his sentencing hearing?
title: Will Sean Combs speak at his sentencing hearing?

description: Music mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs faces sentencing on two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution. NBC News' Chloe Melas reports on the initial arguments presented at the hearing and Combs' family showing up to support him as he awaits sentencing.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' family in attendance at hearing as he awaits sentencing

description: It’s probably not news to you that Taylor Swift released her new album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on Friday. So whether you’re a diehard Swiftie or just want to know what people are talking about, NBC News’ Emilie Ikeda has what you need to know about Swift’s new era in just 45 seconds.
title: 45 second breakdown of Taylor Swift’s new album

author: Rebecca Shabad
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump said he’s giving Hamas until 6 p.m. Sunday to accept the ceasefire proposal his administration offered this week to end the war in Gaza.“If this LAST CHANCE agreement is not reached, all HELL, like no one has ever seen before, will break out against Hamas,” Trump wrote Friday in a lengthy post on Truth Social
title: Trump says Hamas has until Sunday evening to accept Gaza peace proposal or 'all hell' will 'break out'

author: Rebecca Shabad
description: The Trump administration announced Friday that the White House is putting $2.1 billion in funding for Chicago infrastructure projects on hold, the latest move to target Democratic-run cities during the government shutdown.
title: Trump administration pauses $2.1 billion for Chicago infrastructure projects

description: First female Archbishop of Canterbury appointed
title: First female Archbishop of Canterbury appointed

description: Taylor Swift names her favorite song on her new album
title: Taylor Swift names her favorite song on her new album

description: Apple removes ICEBlock app after criticism
title: Apple removes ICEBlock app after criticism

description: Taylor Swift has 'never been so excited' over new album
title: Taylor Swift has 'never been so excited' over new album

description: Israel detains Gaza aid flotilla activists
title: Israel detains Gaza aid flotilla activists

description: Fans pack New York store for new Taylor Swift album
title: Fans pack New York store for new Taylor Swift album

author: Jamie Gray
description: Sarah Mullally is the first woman to be named to the post of Archbishop of Canterbury in the history of the Church of England.
title: Woman is named Archbishop of Canterbury for first time in Church of England history

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: Most of President Donald Trump’s supporters back keeping tax credits for Affordable Care Act plans, the central obstacle in ending the government shutdown, according to a new poll.
title: 'Clear message': A majority of Trump supporters back extending Obamacare subsidies, poll finds

author: Steve Kopack
description: For people who closely follow the U.S. economy, the first Friday of every month is known as “jobs Friday,” when the Bureau of Labor Statistics releases the previous month’s employment report at precisely 8:30 a.m. ET.
title: Government shutdown delays key monthly jobs report at a pivotal moment for the U.S. economy

author: Erika Edwards
description: Measles outbreaks continue to simmer and spread across the country, with cases now popping up quickly in Minnesota
title: Measles is spreading in these states. Here's what to know.

description: Prince William opens up about the royal family's future
title: Prince William opens up about the royal family's future

description: Massive blaze erupts at Chevron refinery in California
title: Massive blaze erupts at Chevron refinery in California

author: Phil Helsel
description: A large fire was reported Thursday night at a Los Angeles-area oil refinery, prompting a response by first responders, according to officials and video that captured the scene.
title: Fire at Los Angeles-area Chevron oil refinery is contained

description: Rep. Ocasio-Cortez discusses government shutdown
title: Rep. Ocasio-Cortez discusses government shutdown

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs writes apology letter to judge
